results.title: The Girl who spelled freedom
results.creator_credit: Simon Wincer, R.W. Goodwin and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Based on newspaper articles and personal interviews with Linn Yann, this moving film tells of one young Cambodian girl refugees experiences in America and her fight to be accepted. With the support of her caring American sponsors (played by Mary Kay Place and Wayne Rogers), Linn Yann (Jade Chinn) overcomes the strangeness of her new country and makes a name for herself by winning the regional spelling competition, thus bringing attention to the plight of other refugees like her.

results.title: The Black book = Reign of terror
results.creator_credit: Anthony Mann, William Cameron Menzies and JEF Films
results.brief_description: The title of this film refers to the book naming the individuals the sadistic ruler of France during the Revolution, Robespierre (Richard Basehart), plans to execute by guillotine. Charles D’Aubigny (Robert Cummings), is enlisted by a group of political moderates to try and retrieve the book and expose Robespierre’s corruption. Also starring Arlene Dahl, Richard Hart, Arnold Moss and Beulah Bondi. The film is also known as “Reign of terror”.

results.title: The Most dangerous game
results.creator_credit: Ernest B Schoedsack, Irving Pichel, Merian C. Cooper and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: King Kongs creators made this excellent tale a year before the famous ape burst onto the scene. A vivid retelling of Richard Connells celebrated oft-filmed story about a megalomaniac named Count Zaroff who hunts humans with a bow and arrow on his private island, and charms everyone he encounters. Joel McRae, Fay Wray and Robert Armstrong are his latest prey.

results.title: Nothing sacred
results.creator_credit: William Wellman, David O. Selznick and Selznick International Pictures
results.brief_description: Carol Lombard is hilariously funny playing the role of Hazel Flagg in this outstanding black comedy. Hazel’s bumbling doctor mistakenly diagnoses her as having fatal radium poisoning. Although she’s never felt better, Hazel pretends to be dying in order to accept the offer of an all-expenses-paid visit to New York City made by a newspaper reporter. By the time the reporter begins churning out daily reports of the tragedy, half of Manhattan is in tears and Hazel is built up to be a brave ‘suffering in silence’ charmer and is lionized by the media and public. When Hazel cannot disguise her good health any longer, a group of her financial backers wise up to her ruse and ask her to find a way to die and save them all further embarassment.This was one of the first screwball comedies ever produced, and possibly one of the finest.

results.title: Hell in the Pacific
results.creator_credit: John Boorman, Reuben Bercovitch and Selmur Pictures
results.brief_description: Set during the second World War, this film concerns an American marine pilot (Marvin), who is stalked by a Japanese navy officer (Mifune), while stranded on a remote Pacific island. The American is captured but manages to escape and turn into the captor of the Japanese navy officer. After a while they realise they need not be adversaries and begin an uneasy friendship and dependency on each other for survival.

results.title: Decameron nights
results.brief_description: Based on the medieval romance collection by Boccaccio, Louis Jourdan (the author) narrates three of Boccaccio’s tales including; “Paganino the pirate”, “Wager for virture” and “The Doctor’s daughter”. Starring Joan Fontaine, Binnie Barnes and Joan Collins.

results.title: Never cry wolf
results.creator_credit: Carroll Ballard, Jack Couffer, Joseph Strick, Lewis Allen and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: In the Arctic region wolves are suspected of contributing to the diminishing number of caribou herds. “The Lupine project” is established by the government to investigate and observe wolves to provide concrete evidence of their aggressive nature. A young biologist, Tyler (Charles Martin Tyler), is left alone in the unfriendly Arctic wilderness to conduct such a study where he must contend with the forces of nature to discover as much as he can about the canis lupis; the wolf. Based on Farley Mowat’s autobiographical novel of the same name, screenplay by Curtis Hanson. Also starring Brian Dennehy.

results.title: The Emerald forest
results.creator_credit: John Boorman and Embassy Pictures Corporation (US)
results.brief_description: Based on a true story of American engineer Bill Markham (Powers Boothe), whose son is kidnapped while working in Brazil. His son is kidnapped by a tribe called “The Invisible people”, due to their ability to camouflage. Despite the authorities giving up the search, Markham and a French photographer continue the search, until the photographer is killed and the father must go on alone. Cast also includes Meg Foster, Charley Boorman and Rui Polonah. Made in the Amazon rainforest and written by Rospo Pallenberg.

results.title: Marked woman
results.creator_credit: Lloyd Bacon, Hal B. Wallis, Jack L. Warner, Louis F. Edelman and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: A hard boiled B-girl (Bette Davis), is determined to turn the tables on Mobster Johnny Vanning (Eduardo Ciannelli), who has recently taken over the management of the nightclub where she works and is attempting to turn out the current employees. It proves to be hard task for one individual so she enlists the help of a district attorney (Bogart), and her fellow workers at the nightclub (Rosalind Marquis, Lola Lane, Isabel Jewell and Mayo Methot). This film is based on the trial of New York Gangster Lucky Luciano, sent to prison on the basis of evidence from prostitutes.

results.title: Patty Hearst
results.creator_credit: Paul Schrader, Marvin Worth and Zenith Productions
results.brief_description: In 1974 Californian newspaper heiress Patty Hearst (Natasha Richardson), was kidnapped and allegedly brainwashed by terrorists from the Symbionese Liberation Army (SLA). She caused public scandal when she rejected the offer for freedom after 57 days of being confined in a closet and becoming a successful bank robbing urban guerilla. Also starring William Forsythe, Ving Rhames and Frances Fisher. Based on the book “Every secret thing” by Patricia Campbell Hearst and Alvin Moscow.
